page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: Dorset is shared by us with animals,birds,fish and plants,etc. The countryside teams with rabbits, and warrens are found quite frequently in hedges and sandbanks. Poachers lay rabbit snares and shoot the creatures with silenced shotguns and sometimes use rabbit-poison which kills straight-away or causes myxomatosis.Poison is banned but poachers still use it. Rabbits have a habit of stopping right in their tracks if a light is shone in their eyes. Farmers shoot rabbits to keep them from damaging corn before the roots can settle.inspite of all the shooting,the population is large and increasing.Rabbits can be eaten in stew or with onion sauce or parsley.
